FILE: cm220660v11.0.txt
DYAD: FRANCE - LEBANON
RIVALRY: RIV583
DISPUTE(S): MID3907 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20180213
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20180213

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID3907 

TERRMID: MID3907 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3907 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3907 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3907 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3907 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3907 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3907 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3907 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3907 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3907 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3907 from Gibler (2018), France deployed a naval vessel to Lebanon to support the Christian army there. There was an ongoing civil war at the time, and France wanted to deter another outbreak of conflict. Coded civil war MID because the civil war in Lebanon was ongoing and fears of another outbreak of battles led France to support one of the militarized groups via a show of force. 

CIVWARLINK: MID3907 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3907 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3907 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3907 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3907 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3907 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 
RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:
The French military headquarters in Beruit was bombed by terrorists on October 23, 1983, resulting in the deaths of 58 French soldiers. French military aircraft attacked Islamic militants near Baalbek on November 17, 1983, resulting in the deaths of some 39 individuals.

SOURCES-CM: 
*Keesing,* January 1984.

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
